title: Tripping Daisy Announces First Tour in 26 Years
description: Tim DeLaughter and co. will celebrate their album I Am an Elastic Firecracker, which turns 30 this year. Tripping Daisy Announces First Tour in 26 Years Jaeden Pinder
author: Jaeden Pinder
excerpt: Tripping Daisy announced their first tour in 26 years. They’ll be playing their album I Am An Elastic Firecracker in full to celebrate its 30th anniversary.
text: Tripping Daisy are reuniting to tour North America for this first time in 26 years. The summer outing comes is in celebration of their album I Am an Elastic Firecracker, which turns 30 this year. To commemorate the occasion, frontman Tim DeLaughter and co. have promised to play Firecracker in full alongside other fan favorites. The tour kicks off in their native Dallas on June 21st, before they head through the Midwest, including Denver, St. Louis, Chicago, Columbus and more. After that, they’ll hit two shows in Canada before finishing out the tour on the East coast. The final concert is scheduled for July 20th in Charlotte. Tickets for select dates will go on sale this Friday, April 18th at 10:00 a.m. via Ticketmaster. Get Tripping Daisy Tickets Here Tripping Daisy was founded in 1990 by DeLaughter, but disbanded in 1999 following the unexpected death of guitarist Wes Berggren. DeLaughter and his bandmates reformed a year later as The Polyphonic Spree. Tripping Daisy’s most recent album was their self-titled record, released in 2000. Along with their upcoming tour dates, the band has plans to release a new album. Tripping Daisy 2025 Tour Dates: 06/21 — Dallas, TX @ Bomb Factory 06/22 — Oklahoma City, OK @ Beer City Music Hall 06/23 — Kansas City, MO @ Warehouse on Broadway 06/25 — Denver, CO @ Marquis Theater 06/27 — Omaha, NE @ The Waiting Room 06/28 — St. Paul, MN @ Turf Club 06/29 — Des Moines, IA @ Wooly’s 07/01 — St. Louis, MO @ Off Broadway 07/02 — Chicago, IL @ The Bottom Lounge 07/04 — Milwaukee, WI @ Summerfest 07/05 — Indianapolis, IN @ The Vogue 07/08 — Cleveland, OH @ House of Blues 07/09 — Columbus, OH @ A&R Music Bar 07/10 — Detroit, MI @ El Club 07/11 — Toronto, ON @ Lee’s Palace 07/12 — Montreal, QC @ Theatre Fairmount 07/14 — Hamden, CT @ Space Ballroom 07/16 — Boston, MA @ Brighton Music Hall 07/17 — New York, NY @ Le Poisson Rouge 07/18 — Philadelphia, PA @ Union Transfer 07/19 — Raleigh, NC @ Lincoln Theatre 07/20 — Charlotte, NC @ The Underground
html:
Tripping Daisy are reuniting to tour North America for this first time in 26 years. The summer outing comes is in celebration of their album I Am an Elastic Firecracker, which turns 30 this year. To commemorate the occasion, frontman Tim DeLaughter and co. have promised to play Firecracker in full alongside other fan favorites.

The tour kicks off in their native Dallas on June 21st, before they head through the Midwest, including Denver, St. Louis, Chicago, Columbus and more. After that, they’ll hit two shows in Canada before finishing out the tour on the East coast. The final concert is scheduled for July 20th in Charlotte. Tickets for select dates will go on sale this Friday, April 18th at 10:00 a.m. via Ticketmaster.

Get Tripping Daisy Tickets Here

Tripping Daisy was founded in 1990 by DeLaughter, but disbanded in 1999 following the unexpected death of guitarist Wes Berggren. DeLaughter and his bandmates reformed a year later as The Polyphonic Spree. Tripping Daisy’s most recent album was their self-titled record, released in 2000. Along with their upcoming tour dates, the band has plans to release a new album.
